Detailed Description

Store and manipulate GPS data (time, date, location).

Member Function Documentation

CString CGPSData::formatDate (  )  [inline]

Output GPS date as formatted string (note that this date is based on GPS UTC clock): "yyyy-mm-dd " with the assumption that the recorded year is between 2000 and 2099 Unknown date will be printed as "Unknown date "

CString CGPSData::formatLoc (  )  [inline]

Output GPS location as formatted string: "[deg][N/S] [deg][E/W] [m][m] " Unknown lat/lon/alt values will be replaced with "??"

CString CGPSData::formatTime (  )  [inline]

Output GPS time (UTC) as formatted string: "hh:mm:ss UTC " Unknown time will be printed as "Unknown time "

double CGPSData::getAlt ( void   )  [inline]

Retrieve altitude [m] ... return 36000000 if not known.

void CGPSData::setData ( double *  lat,
double *  lon,
double *  alt,
double *  spd,
double *  dir,
CTime *  timestamp,
CString *  name 
) [inline]

Store data in class.

Wrapper function. Only difference to previous function is Timestamp in CTime format

void CGPSData::setData ( double *  lat,
double *  lon,
double *  alt,
double *  spd,
double *  dir,
INT32 *  xtime,
INT32 *  xdate,
char *  name 
)

Store data in class.

Wrapper function. Only difference to previous function is GPS name in char* format

void CGPSData::setData ( double *  lat,
double *  lon,
double *  alt,
double *  spd,
double *  dir,
INT32 *  xtime,
INT32 *  xdate,
CString *  name 
)

Store data in class.

All parameters are passed as pointers and a NULL pointer value indicates that no valid data for this parameter is known / being supplied.

Parameters:
lat - latitude [deg], negative values S
lon - longitude [deg], negative values W
alt - altitude [m]
spd - speed [knots?]
dir - direction [deg?]
xtime - time [int32 = hhmmss]
xdate - date [int32 = ddmmyy]
name - GPS name
